channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Approx 15" x 8" wide pothole, 13th November
item.description:
Pothole is in middle of road - deeper than a golf ball. In middle of road but as cars park on one side of road it is often in the wheel path and could cause serious damage to small cars
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1A, Copt Elm Close, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Raised iron works with no warnings, 13th November
item.description:
Along London road near 221 - raised iron works with no signage and no way to avoid them unless you drive on the other side of the road into oncoming traffic. This has burst my tyre resulting in a new tyre being needed
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 279, London Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 13th November
item.description:
tree down over the cycle path - from the grounds richmount retirement village GL51 6PN there is a tree surgeon attending tomorrow 14/11/2023 @07:30
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water coming from underground, 13th November
item.description:
Location is on the green behind 10 Huxley way. Pools of water gathering, creating dangerously soft ground and deep pools of water. Doesnâ€™t dry up and has become worse (more pools of water appearing) and becoming dangerously close to property fence.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 13th November
item.description:
email rcvd 10.11.23 - Please send me the claims procedure for damage to vehicles. Yesterday I had an incident resulting in a bicycle flat tyre. The expense will be low, but I'd like to claim for the tyre tube cost and possible repair costs. I have a video recording of the incident and, from information available, it appears GCC have failed to inspect and maintain the road sufficiently and/or adequately repair damage to the road.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water bubbling through tarmac, 13th November
item.description:
Opposite farm. After the heavy rainfall 2 weeks ago, water has constantly been bubbling through the tarmac causing a constant puddle and stream to the drainage down the road. This occurred last year causing the road to become icy in cold weather.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Lane, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Water bubbling from the drain flooding the road., 13th November
item.description:
Opposite properties Woods Cottage and Hillview. Issue happens every rainfall and takes a couple of days to clear.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Lane, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 13th November
item.description:
The 30mph repeater sign is missing from the post and the post seems to be damaged/leaning. Sign is important to show 30mph limit when approaching cycleway at junction with B4063.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Builders regularly blocking shared pathway with vehicles, 13th November
item.description:
Been an ongoing problem for weeks. Builders have decided the shared path is a fair game parking space leaving no room for either pedestrians or cyclists to pass. Please enforce or provide alternative infrastructure. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 88b, Lansdown Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pile of sticks / vegetation detritus, 13th November
item.description:
Corner of Glencairn Park Road and Glencairn Court. Pile of sticks and other vegetation rubbish, pushed into pile on back of pavement. Been there for MONTHS. Needs removing, along with a general street cleanse in the area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1a, Glencairn Park Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Streetlight too bright outside house, 13th November
item.description:
27 Gloucester Street, winchcombe. The street light that is attached to the side of my house is unbearably bright. It floods my upstairs bedroom with bright light at night that can not be blocked out with blinds. Please can you fit a black shield to the light to prevent the light flooding in. This has been an issue since all the street lights were changed to ultra bright LED. I have tried multiple ways to block it out but nothing works. I have seen that other houses have had the dark shield fitted on Gloucester Street and would like one too.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Gloucester Street, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 13th November
item.description:
FMS 10.11.23 - Flood sign still showing road closed. The flood sign off the A38 onto the B4213 is down saying the road is closed between Apperley and Tirley still - this road has been open for a week now and is putting off drivers using the road.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 13th November
item.description:
08:25 customer was travelling south on Kayte Lane and hit a pothole. This has burst their tyre and needs to be replaced, this was a brand new tyre. | Customer says there may have been metal in the tyre, Described as long narrow, pothole on the edge of the carriageway. this felt very deep, customer was only doing 35mph. This may have been caused by vehicles accessing the field.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 13th November
item.description:
email rcvd 10.11.23 - The road surface outside 163 Hewlett Road is disintegrating as predicted due to previous inadequate repairs. The previous 3 or 4 visits by your contractor's have failed to repair the damage, the anticipated repairs did not happen in July. It requires yet another visit for rectification work, I would ask that you monitor the contractors closely on this repair to ensure that it is completed properly this time, a repair like this should not require multiple visits to repair at public expense. The history of this particular pothole are in this email thread. I have previously raised concerns about the management and control of contractors by GCC, the Zone 15 fiasco support these concerns.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 13th November
item.description:
There is a deep pothole near the roundabout that has been repaired recently but is now around 9 inches deep. Customer states that a utility company has been working in the area recently and there have not repaired the hole properly.
Report on FixMyStreet
